;一名香港的士司机因涉嫌驾驶醉酒的马来西亚人而被控非法监禁一名游客到建筑工地，在丈夫从尖沙咀酒店的出租车里出来后，将她留在那里 30 分钟。

;

;这名 25 岁的女子和她 26 岁的丈夫一直在一家酒吧喝酒据警方称，周六晚上在中环酒吧，然后在周日凌晨叫了一辆出租车将他们送回他们在北京道的酒店。

;

;

;丈夫立即报了警。

;

;调查人员发现，他涉嫌将这名女子带到观塘安达臣道的一个建筑工地，并让她在那里停留了大约 30 分钟。

;北京和华盛顿对两国之间的紧张局势负有共同责任，富有成果的关系只会一位美国高级外交官周二表示，如果它是一条“双向街”，则有可能。国务卿安东尼·布林肯结束了对中国首都为期两天的访问。

;

;“中美关系的成功和负责任的管理只有在这条两条道路上才有可能，它根本不反映现实，断言双边关系中的所有问题和紧张局势都是由一方或单一原因造成的是不合理的，”克里滕布林克说。

;

;回应北京方面认为紧张局势克里滕布林克表示，事实并非如此，两国在稳定关系方面有共同利益。

;

;在克里滕布林克看来，布林肯与中国官员的会谈取得了美国三个目标：加强高层沟通渠道，明确美方在分歧领域的立场和意图；并探索两国可以就共同利益开展合作的领域。

;

;布林肯在与习近平主席和其他中国高级官员的会晤中“明确而有力地”解释了美国的政策。

;

; Kritenbrink 说，预计包括外交部长秦刚在内的中国内阁成员也将访问美国。

;

;但在与习近平会面后，布林肯表示中国还没有准备好恢复两军接触，这是美国认为避免误判和冲突至关重要，尤其是在台湾问题上。克里滕布林克表示，华盛顿将继续努力建立这种联系。

;

;上个月，当北京拒绝美国国防部长与中国国防部长在

;

;中国外交部当时表示，美方“清楚中美军事对话面临困难的原因”。

;

;“美国发言人毛宁说：“应切实尊重中国的主权、安全和利益关切，立即纠正错误做法，拿出诚意，为中美两军对话沟通创造必要的氛围和条件。”

;

;两国之间紧张局势的主要根源，美国实施了大量关税、出口禁令和投资限制，近年来形成了排他性贸易集团。

;

;周二，Kritenbrink 还驳斥了华盛顿试图脱钩的说法

;

;“没有脱钩战略，但美国当然会奉行去风险战略，但考虑到每年近 70 亿美元的贸易流量，以及美国对华投资正处于低位的事实这是自 2014 年以来的最高水平，我认为很清楚我们的做法是什么，不是什么，”他说。

;

;克里滕布林克表示，美国将与中国展开激烈竞争，但会负责任地管理这场竞争。

;

;“我们对中华人民共和国带来的挑战了如指掌，我们致力于推进我们与许多其他国家共享的未来愿景，一个自由、开放、稳定和繁荣的世界，与各国维护和更新多年来维护全球和平与安全的基于规则的秩序，”他说。

;

;中国驻欧盟大使傅聪在中欧国际工商学院组织的活动上发表讲话说脱钩“既不可取也不可行”。

;

;他还警告不要夸大据称会促使“去风险”战略的“风险”。

;

;“我们不想看到去风险变成脱钩，只是换个名字，”傅说，并补充说任何国家都不应寻求改变彼此的社会制度。

;

;

;总部位于新加坡的 Grab Holdings，东南亚领先的叫车和送餐应用程序，其首席执行官周二表示，正在裁员 1,000 个工作岗位或裁员 11%，理由是需要管理成本并确保长期提供更实惠的服务。

;

;在周二晚些时候发给员工的一封信中，路透社看到，首席执行官 Anthony Tan 表示，此次裁员是自大流行开始以来最大规模的裁员，并不是“盈利的捷径”，而是为适应商业环境而进行的战略重组。

;

;“改变从来没有这么快。生成式 AI（人工智能）等技术正在以惊人的速度发展。资本成本上升，直接影响了竞争格局，”Tan 在信中说。

;

;“我们必须将我们的规模与灵活的执行力和成本领先优势结合起来，这样我们才能可持续地提供更实惠的产品

;

;Grab美国上市后，SPAC会在香港和新加坡起飞吗？

;

;Tan表示，即使不裁员，Grab也有管理成本，应该会在今年实现集团调整后 Ebitda 收支平衡的目标。

;

;“超级应用”成立于 2012 年，在八个东南亚国家/地区提供送货、乘车和金融服务，包括印度尼西亚、马来西亚、菲律宾、新加坡、泰国和越南。

;

;在 Tan 向员工宣布这一消息后，其股价盘前上涨 4.7%。该股盘前涨幅高达 5.6%，延续早前彭博社报道裁员后的涨幅。

;

;5 月，Grab 报告季度亏损 2.5 亿美元，但表示第一季度实现收入今年的收入比一年前增长了 130.3%，达到 5.25 亿美元。

;

;新加坡国会议员 Tin Pei Ling 在公众强烈抗议后调任 Grab

;

;2 月，该公司发布了乐观的预测为 2023 年全年收入，并提前了盈利时间表。

;

;在美国上市的 Grab 上一次裁员是在 2020 年，当时有 360 人因疫情的影响而被解雇。该公司最新的年度报告称，截至 2022 年底，该公司拥有 11,934 名员工，其中约 2,000 名员工来自去年收购的一家杂货连锁店。

;

;去年 9 月，该公司表示没有计划在市场疲软的情况下进行大规模裁员。 12 月，Tan 告诉员工，公司将冻结大部分招聘、高级管理人员的工资，并削减差旅和费用预算。

;前总统唐纳德特朗普将面临 2023 年 8 月 14 日的审判日期联邦政府指控他处理机密文件不当。

;

;特朗普被指控在 2021 年 1 月离开白宫后非法持有敏感的国家安全信息，并阻挠政府查明和查明其身份的努力检索记录。上周，他在迈阿密联邦法庭上对联邦指控他处理国家机密不当的指控表示不认罪。

;

;美国地区法官艾琳坎农周二下令迅速开始审判。上周，被任命调查特朗普的特别检察官杰克·史密斯要求尽快审理此案。

;

;专家称，特朗普无权解密秘密核武器文件

;

;八月14 审判日期不是一成不变的。前总统的律师可以提出延期动议，要么是因为他们需要更多时间准备审判，要么是出于其他原因。

;

;正在努力重返白宫的特朗普是第一个曾面临联邦刑事指控的前总统。

;

;检察官声称特朗普在他的海湖庄园度假胜地保存了高度敏感的文件，他们说其中一些文件涉及核计划和军事攻击计划。起诉书指控特朗普 37 项罪名。有些人被判处长达 10 年的徒刑。其他指控的最高刑期可达 20 年。

;

;共和党明年总统竞选提名的主要候选人特朗普否认有不当行为，并抨击此案具有政治动机。

;

;特朗普在寻求连任时面临越来越多的法律威胁。史密斯提起的针对他的联邦案件是在 3 月份在曼哈顿开庭审理的纽约州刑事案件之后进行的。该起诉是针对在特朗普赢得 2016 年大选之前向色情明星支付的封口费。他拒不不认罪，并表示这是让他下台的更大政治努力的一部分。

;

;特朗普还可能因涉嫌干预 2020 年选举结果而面临佐治亚州的州指控以及与 1 月大选有关的联邦指控6 袭击国会大厦。

;

;

;虽然它没有直接点名中国，但与经济安全相关的决策将经过地缘政治过滤，而北京肯定是这种思考的关键。

;

;

;

;

;“我们拥有整个经济领域，我想再次强调，与中国的绝大多数贸易和经济关系是'一切照旧”，这位德国人说，并补充说，“确保”欧洲不会“增强一些国家的军事能力”也很重要。年列入高科技产品清单，欧盟公司在某些国家的公司可以与成员国一起进行筛选。同样，中国在这方面没有被点名，但它坚定地处于欧盟的关注范围内。

;

;

;

;但要让欧盟 27 个成员国授予布鲁塞尔对这些传统上由其首都控制的地区更多权力，该提案面临着一场艰苦的战斗。一些成员也反对被视为向华盛顿倾斜和经济政策的“国家安全化”。

;

;中国准备在今年审查新的 AI 立法

;

;“我们是欧洲，而不是美国”，这是一位官员在 6 月初听取该计划简报时的反馈，当时邮报报道。一位西欧外交官将他们的观点总结为：“国家安全就是国家安全。”

;

;强调布鲁塞尔与一些大成员国之间的距离，该文件是在德国和中国政府举行磋商的当天发布的在柏林。

;

;当委员会提议去风险时，德国总理奥拉夫·舒尔茨正在为中国总理李强自今年早些时候上任以来的首次出访铺开红地毯。

; Tue, 20 Jun 2023 20:50:02 +0800 In era of streaming, fans try to ‘game system’ to save shows on platforms like Netflix, Primehttps://www.scmp.com/news/world/united-states-canada/article/3224767/era-streaming-fans-try-game-system-save-shows-platforms-netflix-prime?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.06.20 20:30;
;;

;纽约居民尼基·罗德里格斯希望 Netflix 续订奇幻剧集《影与骨》——所以以至于她已经看了 15 遍第二季。

;

;她在社交媒体上宣传粉丝视频以吸引新观众。 She has also created a Change.org petition that has about 1,800 signatures.

;

;“It's unfortunate they are making the fans wait so long,” said 47-year-old Rodriguez, who's been in limbo since the latest episodes debuted in March. “We're really rallying to get the show renewed.”

;

;Over the years, fans have taken drastic measures to keep their favourite programmes from getting cancelled.去年，一架飞机飞过 Netflix 的办公室，上面写着“拯救明日传奇”的横幅，试图在 CW 网络取消后挽救 DC 超级英雄节目。 One fan went on a hunger strike to rescue Netflix's science fiction series The OA.

;

;Both efforts failed.

;

;

;

;Figuring out what metrics make a streaming show successful can bewilder fans.是人们看节目的时间吗？或者有多少观众看完了这一季？ Does social media buzz count?

;

;It is something that many Hollywood writers also want to know as they continue to strike in pursuit of a better deal with the studios. The problem is, unless the show is popular, that data is mostly hidden from the public, making it difficult to calculate the market value of a show or movie.

;

;While measurement firm Nielsen calculates viewing time for streaming shows and films, it only releases data for the top 10 titles for any given week in each category. Netflix posts its own rankings online detailing how many hours each show was watched – but only for its most popular titles.

;

;“There's this black box, which is the data that the streamers control that they are not sharing with … valued artists and valued suppliers because it is so peculiar the way they measure success,” said Tom Nunan, a former studio and network executive.

;

;The 'Netflix Effect' launched K-content to superstardom. But is it paying off?

;

;Traditional broadcast and cable networks determine whether a show is a hit based on Nielsen ratings, which reveal the average number of households tuning in, the show's share of TV viewing during its time slot and audience demographics. A show's success often is judged within days of its debut.

;

;With streaming, it is different, and varies from company to company.一些流媒体，如 Netflix，会观察节目在其存在的头 28 天内的表现如何。 Others consider longer periods of time – 75 and 80 days, in some cases, for programmes that release one episode a week, rather than whole seasons all at once.

;

;Netflix says it offers viewing metrics to showrunners, more than what is publicly available, but declined to go into specifics.亚马逊表示，它为节目主持人提供了对表演的洞察力，但拒绝详细说明。 Hulu and Warner Bros Discovery declined to comment on how they view metrics.

;

;Streamers use a variety of metrics, including how many hours people watched a given show and what percentage of the series viewers completed. Executives also factor in production and marketing costs.

;

;A key variable is how many subscribers a show brings in. Streaming services need to have enough compelling content to attract a broad audience and keep consumers spending more time on their apps, instead of rival entertainment destinations like TikTok and Fortnite.

;

;Streamers are facing increased scrutiny in terms of whether they are getting a return on their content investment. Wall Street has increased pressure on streaming services to boost profits, after years of focusing mostly on subscriber growth.

;

;“People are asking the tough questions, and with asking tough questions, you have to be more rigorous, more analytical,” said Alejandro Rojas, vice-president of applied analytics at research firm Parrot Analytics.

;

;At Amazon, key metrics include watch time and whether a show attracts new members to Prime, which gives perks like music streaming, access to original shows and free shipping.

;

;Amazon, like most streamers, discloses viewership stats selectively.

;

;One household only: Netflix password crackdown expands worldwide

;

;Last year, Amazon Studios launched its most expensive TV show yet, The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power, spending more than US$700 million, including the TV rights, for the first season, according to people familiar with the budget.

;

;The show broke viewership records on its first day, with more than 25 million people tuning in. More than 65 per cent of the audience for The Rings of Power was outside the US, Amazon said.

;

;Earlier this year, Amazon launched the spy thriller series Citadel, starring Richard Madden and Priyanka Chopra Jonas, which the tech giant says is its third most-watched new original series worldwide.

;

;Anonymous industry blog the Entertainment Strategy Guy refers to such comparative measurements as “datecdotes”, because they lack specific numbers. During its first three weeks of release, Citadel did not crack the top 10 for Nielsen streaming ratings, which measures US viewing on TV sets.

;

;The show, which some estimated cost US$250 million to make, drew new Prime members internationally, including in countries like India, South Africa and New Zealand. Amazon did not give specific numbers.

;

;“When you're looking at how many people are signing up for the service, in country after country outside of the US, it's huge,” said Vernon Sanders, head of television at Amazon and MGM Studios. “On some of our global tentpoles, our audience outside the US is a multiple of what it is inside the US.”

;

;

;

;Elements other than audience data and financial considerations can influence programming decisions. Those may include the desire to maintain relationships with top-tier creators, as well as the allure of winning prestigious awards.

;

;The benefits of social media buzz are fuzzy to interpret. While tweets and TikToks can help drum up attention for streaming shows, they do not always translate into more viewers.

;

;For example, passionate fans tweeted enthusiastically about Netflix's Warrior Nun.与 Netflix 的一些更受欢迎的节目相比，一小群粉丝发布的关于该系列的推文更多。 But that did not drive enough viewership for the series to continue, according to a person familiar with the show's production who was not authorised to comment.

;

;More than half of Netflix's US English-language scripted shows get renewed annually, the company said. The opaque reasons some survive and others don not can spark controversy online.

;

;Fans protested when the vampire series First Kill was cancelled while coming-of-age love story Heartstopper was renewed. However, First Kill had a much lower completion rate and was significantly more expensive to make than Heartstopper, the knowledgeable person said.

;

;So what does this mean for a potential Shadow and Bone Season 3?

;

;Where do streaming services like Netflix, Amazon, Disney+ go from here?

;

;First, look to the past.根据全球观看时长，《影与骨》第 2 季连续五周登上 Netflix 英语剧集电视排行榜前 10 名。 It also placed in the top 10 by watch time in 86 countries, including the US.

;

;While getting on Netflix's weekly top 10 list is an achievement, it does not guarantee anything.

;

;What separates the renewed from the cancelled is often the length of time a show spends on the top 10 list and its international reach, Netflix said.

;

;“One of the hardest parts of this job is deciding when it's time to cancel a show,” said Peter Friedlander, Netflix's vice-president of scripted series for the US and Canada. “Every show is a result of years of hard work of people in front of and behind the camera, so these aren't decisions we take lightly.”

;

;Netflix 'done with shrinking', grows subscribers ahead of ad-supported streaming

;

;Friedlander added: “I know what it feels like to connect to characters and a story and then be disappointed when it's not renewed. We make these decisions the same way they've been made for decades – is there a large enough audience for this show relative to the cost, and most importantly, what is the creative direction and vision.”

;

;Diehard Shadow and Bone fans are eager to boost the show's stats and have engaged in creative gambits to improve its chances.

;

;Some fans encouraged people to replay the second season muted in the background to rack up more viewing hours for the show, according to Rolling Stone. But two former Netflix employees who spoke to the LA Times doubted this tactic would work.

;

;Netflix has roughly 233 million subscribers globally. It would be more effective for Shadow and Bone superfans to recruit new viewers rather than watching Season 2 repeatedly from the same account, the ex-employees said.

;

;“You can't game the system,” one of the former staffers said.

;

;Netflix said it has not made a decision on Shadow and Bone Season 3 yet. As with many shows across the entertainment industry, programming conversations are on hold due to the writers' strike, a company spokesperson said.

;Online influencer Andrew Tate, his brother and two Romanian women were indicted in Romania on human trafficking and rape charges, prosecutors said on Tuesday, six months after they were detained.

;

;The anti-organised crime prosecution's unit (DIICOT) “ordered the indictment” of the four defendants for offences including “setting up an organised criminal group … trafficking in persons … rape”, they said.

;

;Romanian police arrested Tate, 36, and his brother Tristan, 34, and two Romanian women late last year. Under preventive detention at first, they were placed under house arrest at the end of March.

;

;They deny all the accusations.

;

;“It was held that, in early 2021, the four defendants formed an organised criminal group with a view to committing the crime of trafficking in persons on the territory of Romania, but also in other countries, such as the United States and the United Kingdom,” DIICOT said in a statement.

;

;Pizza boxes and toxic masculinity: Who is Andrew Tate and why was he arrested?

;

;In addition to the charges of human trafficking and rape – both “in continuous form” – the four are also indicted for “illegal access to a computer system, altering the integrity of computer data, instigation to assault or other violence and assault or other violence”.

;

;DIICOT say the brothers and their accomplices allegedly trafficked, recruited and exploited women by coercing them into “pornographic acts with a view to producing and disseminating such material” online.

;

;As part of the probe, Romanian police have raided several properties connected to the Tate brothers and seized assets, including a collection of luxury cars.

;

;A dual citizen of the US and Britain, former kickboxer Andrew Tate moved to Romania years ago, after first starting a webcam business in the UK.

;

;In 2016, Tate appeared on the Big Brother reality television show in Britain but was removed after a video emerged showing him attacking a woman.

;

;He then turned to social media platforms to promote his divisive views. He currently has 6.9 million followers on Twitter.

;

;Giving tips on how to be successful, along with misogynist and sometimes violent maxims, his videos have made him one of the world's best-known influencers.
